question: 1. I heard that if a woman shows some part of her body then that part wil b burnt in the fire of hell.. is this a true hadith.. pls provide with proper reference..
answer:
QUESTION

1. Assalam,my question is related hijab..I heard that if a woman shows some part of her body then that part wil b burnt in the fire of hell.. is this a true hadith.. pls provide with proper reference..
2. I always try to restrict my self from Interest which is haram. but due to a very critical problem that too in a critical situation  my parents got a loan from bank. that situation was unavoidable v did not have any other choice left but my parents tried too much to avoid interest by crying in front of ALLAH during thahajudh.will ALLAH forgive us for this? now only that money is used for all the purpose even for eating. what can i do now?I cant leave out of my house too as i am just doing my degree..

ANSWER

In the name of Allah, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

Assalaamu `alaykum waRahmatullahi Wabarakatoh

1.       Abu Hurairah (radiallahu anhu) narrates that Rasulullah (salallahu alayhi wasallam) said “There are two groups who will enter the fire of hell. One will be a group who will have whips like the tails of cattle and they would hit people with those whips and a woman who would be dressed but (in reality) will be naked, strange men will be inclined towards her and she would be inclined towards strange men, their heads (hair style) would look like the humps of camels, these people will not enter Jannah neither would they enjoy the fragrance of paradise…..”. Sahih Muslim

 

صحيح مسلم - (ج 14 / ص 229 )

حَدَّثَنِى زُهَيْرُ بْنُ حَرْبٍ حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ عَنْ سُهَيْلٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ أَبِى هُرَيْرَةَ قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- « صِنْفَانِ مِنْ أَهْلِ النَّارِ لَمْ أَرَهُمَا قَوْمٌ مَعَهُمْ سِيَاطٌ كَأَذْنَابِ الْبَقَرِ يَضْرِبُونَ بِهَا النَّاسَ وَنِسَاءٌ كَاسِيَاتٌ عَارِيَاتٌ مُمِيلاَتٌ مَائِلاَتٌ رُءُوسُهُنَّ كَأَسْنِمَةِ الْبُخْتِ الْمَائِلَةِ لاَ يَدْخُلْنَ الْجَنَّةَ وَلاَ يَجِدْنَ رِيحَهَا وَإِنَّ رِيحَهَا لَيُوجَدُ مِنْ مَسِيرَةِ كَذَا وَكَذَا »

The Hadith is clear that a woman who exposes herself to strange men (men she is allowed to marry), will enter hell.

 

2.      You state that your parents had obtained an interest bearing loan in the face of extreme difficulty and dire need. We cannot comment as we do not know the real nature of the need. However, that would not undo the interest loan taken. Since the loan is taken, one should sincerely repent and make Tawbah to Almighty Allah. Furthermore, a concerted effort should be made to pay off this Haraam loan as quickly as possible. The family should sacrifice its luxuries and use the funds wasted in futile items to pay off the interest bearing loan. Often we observe that people take out interest bearing loans but continue with a lavish and exorbitant lifestyle. Surely this reflects the in sincerity of the tawbah and level of remorse and commitment. You should advise your family with regards to the above and encourage them on working towards settling the debt as soon as possible. If you are committed and sincere in doing so, Allah will create the means and avenues from His unseen treasures.

And Allah knows best

Wassalam
